channel.title: I need help putting serveon online
channel.description: Hi I made my server I used HAM I did all of that stuff and it won't turn online. I don't really get no-ip.com or know how to use port forward. Please help me!! Thanks!

item.title: I need help putting serveon online
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Your server is online. When you’re connecting, try using one of the following IP’s;

[ul][li]Server IP: Leave it blank[/li]

[li]Server IP: localhost[/li]

[li]Server IP: Your No-IP domain here[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.source: I need help putting serveon online

item.title: I need help putting serveon online
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

You should see something like this at the bottom of the DUC;

[Fri 18:00]  Checking Remote IP Address.
[Fri 18:00]  Current IP address found, using 88.111.36.221 for updates.
[Fri 18:00]  Retrieving hosts, please wait.
[Fri 18:00]  Host retrieval complete. To add/remove hosts, click here.

Click where it says “click here” and then make a new domain. Once you’ve got that domain, simply provide it to other people and they’ll be able to connect to your server.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help putting serveon online

item.source: I need help putting serveon online

item.title: I need help putting serveon online
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

  1. You don’t need to port forward to get No-IP working.

  2. Don’t use Hamachi.

Ok, all you need to do with No-IP is;Download the No-IP DUC, create a domain and then when you’ve got them both, open the DUC, refresh & update regurarly. Then, go into your source file and simply double-click runserver.BAT.

Read full topic
